question: Customer enabled OSPFv3 between two routers as shown in the topology and configurations below. Link is operational and no filters are applied. OSPFv3 adjacency is not established due to an MTU mismatch. Which configuration command can be applied to stop OSPFv3 from comparing MTU?
options: Apply command "ip ospfv3 mtu-ignore" to both routers R3 and R4 GigabitEthernet interfaces
Apply command "ipv6 ospf mtu-ignore" to both routers R3 and R4 GigabitEthernet interfaces
Apply command "ip mtu-ignore" under "ipv6 router ospf" on both R3 and R4
Apply command "ipv6 mtu-ignore" under "ipv6 router ospf" on both R3 and R4
correct_answers: Apply command "ipv6 ospf mtu-ignore" to both routers R3 and R4 GigabitEthernet interfaces

question: What are the three (3) reasons that may cause eBGP neighbor relationship not to form?
options: Mismatched BGP RIDs
Incorrect neighbor statement
Mismatched authentication
Mismatched BGP AS numbers
Expired TTL value
correct_answers: Incorrect neighbor statement
Mismatched authentication
Expired TTL value

question: Where should a system administrator apply the policy-based routing configuration to direct packets from the 10.0.0.0/8 network through the R2 router to the Internet?
options: RTA interface G0/0
RTB interface G1/0
RTB interface G0/0
RTB interface G0/1
correct_answers: RTB interface G1/0

question: Directly connected networks configured on router R1 are not being shared with neighboring routers through OSPFv3 IPv6. What is the cause of the issue?
options: GigabitEthernet interfaces are not enabled for OSPFv3 route advertisement
IPv6 network statements are missing under the OSPFv3 process
Link-local IPv6 addresses must be manually configured
OSPFv3 router ID should be an IPv6 address
correct_answers: GigabitEthernet interfaces are not enabled for OSPFv3 route advertisement

question: Customer enabled OSPFv3 single area 0 and all links are operational. No filters are enabled but R1 and R2 cannot share routes. What is the problem?
options: OSPFv3 router ID is invalid
There is no DR or BDR election due to OSPFv3 interface priority set to 0 on both R1 and R2
Interfaces require IPv6 addressing
OSPFv3 area types are mismatched
correct_answers: There is no DR or BDR election due to OSPFv3 interface priority set to 0 on both R1 and R2

question: A network administrator is troubleshooting a BGP network where some BGP routes are missing. BGP peers are formed. What are two (2) possible reasons?
options: BGP split horizon rule
Incorrect neighbor statement
Missing or bad network mask command
Mismatched authentication
correct_answers: Incorrect neighbor statement
Missing or bad network mask command

question: Customer enabled OSPFv3 between two routers but adjacency is not forming. Based on the output, what is the cause?
options: IPv6 link-local address mismatch
Router ID mismatch
GigabitEthernet network type mismatch
OSPFv3 process ID mismatch
correct_answers: GigabitEthernet network type mismatch

question: Refer to the exhibit. Which piece of information can be obtained from the AAA configuration commands?
options: The authentication method list used by the console port is named ACCESS.
The local database is checked first when console and Telnet access to the router is being authenticated.
The authentication method list used for Telnet is named ACCESS.
If the TACACS+ AAA server is not available, no users can establish a Telnet session with the router.
correct_answers: The authentication method list used for Telnet is named ACCESS.

question: Which IPv6 First-Hop Security feature can block IPv6 traffic if this traffic is from an unknown origin?
options: IPv6 ND inspection/snooping
Source Guard
RA Guard
DHCPv6 Guard
correct_answers: Source Guard

question: Refer to the exhibit below. An SNMP manager is unable to change configuration variables on the R1 SNMP agent. What could be the problem?
options: Access list 'ACL_SNMP' has not been implemented on an R1 interface yet
The last entry in ACL_SNMP should be permit any instead of deny any
The SNMP agent should have traps disabled
The SNMP agent is not configured for write access.
correct_answers: The SNMP agent is not configured for write access.

question: R2 is redistributing OSPFv3 into EIGRPv6. The route map is supposed to deny two IPv6 loopbacks but allow all other prefixes. No prefixes are being redistributed. How can this be fixed?
options: Configure a "route-map ospf2eigrp deny 5" statement with no match criteria
Change "route-map ospf2eigrp deny 10" to "route-map ospf2eigrp permit 10"
Configure a "route-map ospf2eigrp permit 20" statement with no match criteria
Configure a "route-map ospf2eigrp deny 20" statement with no match criteria
correct_answers: Configure a "route-map ospf2eigrp permit 20" statement with no match criteria

question: A network administrator issues the 'show bgp ipv4 unicast summary' command and sees the State/PfxRcd field showing Active. Which statement best describes the situation?
options: Because the neighbor router has not responded to the BGP Open message the adjacency is not formed.
The neighbor adjacency is successfully formed and prefixes are exchanged
The neighbor adjacency is successfully formed but no prefixes are exchanged
There is an ACL configured on router that is blocking TCP port 179
correct_answers: Because the neighbor router has not responded to the BGP Open message the adjacency is not formed.

question: Which of the following are three (3) methods that can be used to solve routing issues caused by multipoint redistribution? (Choose 3:)?
options: Modify the AD of the redistributed route
Tag routes to avoid them being redistributed back into originating routing source
Modify the seed metrics of the redistributed routes
Perform only one way routes redistribution
correct_answers: Modify the AD of the redistributed route
Tag routes to avoid them being redistributed back into originating routing source
Modify the seed metrics of the redistributed routes

question: Customer enabled CoPP feature on router R1 based on the configuration below. Study the configuration and choose the two (2) actions that will result fromapplying this service policy, (Choose 2:)?
options: ICMP packets will be policed at 10 pps with exceed action to drop
All SSH packets will be dropped
All telnet packets will be dropped
All telnet packets will be allowed but will be policed at 8000 kbps
correct_answers: ICMP packets will be policed at 10 pps with exceed action to drop
All telnet packets will be dropped

question: Customer enabled the CoPP policy based on the configuration below. Which statement is true when this CoPP policy is applied to the router configuration?
options: This CoPP policy allows host with source address of 192.168.1.1 to forward Telnet packets to the control plane and will be policed based on the configured CIR value
This CoPP policy allows host with source address of 192.168.1.1 to forward Telnet packets to the control plane and will not be policed
All Telnet packets will be denied access to the router control plane
This CoPP policy denies host with source address of 192.168.1.1 to forward Telnet packets to the control plane
correct_answers: This CoPP policy allows host with source address of 192.168.1.1 to forward Telnet packets to the control plane and will not be policed

question: A network administrator issues the 'show bgp ipv4 unicast summary' command on a router to check adjacency with a neighbor. The value under the State/PfxRcd field shows Active. The link is working fine between the routers. Which statement describes the status of the BGP adjacency?
options: The BGP adjacency is established
The neighbor router has not responded to the BGP Open message and the adjacency is not formed
The router is receiving prefixes but has not advertised any
The BGP session is in Idle state
correct_answers: The neighbor router has not responded to the BGP Open message and the adjacency is not formed

question: Which two (2) statements are true regarding VRF LITE operation, (Choose 2:)?
options: VRF LITE does not require MPLS LDP to be enabled
VRF LITE configured for multiple customers will create multiple isolated VRF routing tables that is isolated from the global routing table
VRF LITE configured for multiple customers will create a single VRF routing table that is isolated from the global routing table
VRF LITE requires MPLS LDP to be enabled
correct_answers: VRF LITE does not require MPLS LDP to be enabled
VRF LITE configured for multiple customers will create multiple isolated VRF routing tables that is isolated from the global routing table

question: Refer to the exhibit. EIGRP is configured on RouterA and RouterB, and the link is working fine. What can be concluded about the EIGRP authentication between the two routers?
options: EIGRP authentication will fail due to key mismatch
EIGRP authentication will succeed
EIGRP adjacency will remain stuck in Init state
EIGRP uses MD5 hashing by default
correct_answers: EIGRP authentication will succeed

question: Which NHRP message is designed to locate and provide the address resolution information of the egress router toward the destination.
options: Purge
Redirect
Registration
Resolution
correct_answers: Resolution

question: Redistribution between two EIGRP routing processes does not require a seed metric.
options: True
False
correct_answers: True

question:
Customer is trying to establish eBGP peering to an ISP router using direct Serial link IPv4 address. 
The topology and configuration(s) are listed below, the eBGP peering is not established. The link between R3 and ISP is working fine. No Access lists or firewall is blocking the TCP session. 
Study the topology and configurations below and suggest what can be done to correct the configuration to properly establish eBGP peering?
options: add a default route on R3 to ISP router
add 'ebgp-multihop 2' BGP command on both R3 and ISP routers
Change BGP AS number on R3 to match ISP BGP AS number
remove 'update-source Loopback0' BGP command from both R3 and ISP routers
correct_answers: remove 'update-source Loopback0' BGP command from both R3 and ISP routers

question: Based on the exhibit, which command is needed on R2 to redistribute iBGP routes into OSPF process 100?
options:
R2(config)#router bgp 100 ->
R2(config-router)#redistribute-internal

R2(config)#router ospf 100 ->
R2(config-router)#bgp redistribute-internal

R2(config)#router bgp 100 ->
R2(config-router)#bgp redistribute-internal

R2(config)#router bgp 100 ->
R2(config-router)#bgp redistribute-external
correct_answers:
R2(config)#router bgp 100 ->
R2(config-router)#bgp redistribute-internal

question: Customer configures uRPF on a Cisco router interface with the 'ip verify unicast source reachable-via rx allow-default' command to eliminate spoofed IP packets on a network. Which conclusion can be drawn from this configuration?
options: The security feature uRPF is configured with loose mode, and the return traffic will take a route other than the one based on a default route.
The security feature uRPF is configured with strict mode, and the return path is associated with an interface chosen based on a default route.
The security feature uRPF is configured with strict mode, and the return path is associated with an interface other than the default route
The security feature uRPF is configured with loose mode, and the route for return traffic is chosen based on a default route.
correct_answers: The security feature uRPF is configured with strict mode, and the return path is associated with an interface chosen based on a default route.

question: Refer to the exhibit. An administrator is configuring a prefix list to stop advertising 172.18.100.0/24, a secure Branch network, to the internet. After adding the prefix list, the administrator notices that the branch network is still being advertised. How can the administrator fix the error?
options: Modify the order of the statements so that the deny statement is before the permit statement
Modify the permit statement to use ge 32 instead of le 32
Modify the deny statement to seq 15 deny 172.18.0.0/16
The prefix list needs another statement to permit the advertisement of the default route.
correct_answers: Modify the order of the statements so that the deny statement is before the permit statement

question: Based on the error message below from a configured point to point GRE tunnel, which reason this error may have occurred and would cause the Tunnel interface to enter an up/down flapping state?
options: passive interface command is used on GRE tunnel interface
timers mismatch on GRE tunnel interface
GRE tunnel source is using loopback address which is unsupported
The routers try to use the GRE tunnel to reach the tunnel destination address
correct_answers: The routers try to use the GRE tunnel to reach the tunnel destination address

question: Refer to the exhibit. Router R1 is configured as shown. An administrative user attempts to use Telnet from router R2 to R1 using the interface IP address 10.10.10.1. However, Telnet access is denied. Which conclusion can be drawn from this scenario?
options: The password was mistyped.
The username entered should be scrypt
The vty lines must be configured with the login authentication scrypt command
The vty lines must be configured with the login authentication default command
correct_answers: The password was mistyped.

question: Refer to the exhibit. What metric will RIP routes have when redistributed into EIGRP?
options: Infinity
Unreachable
correct_answers: Infinity

question:
Customer is exchanging IPv6 routes using eBGP over IPv4 TCP session. 
Study the configuration below of both R1 and R2. 
Suggest to customer what would be the next hop address to use in the route map on both R1 and R2, (Choose 2:)?
options:
R1# 
route-map set_next_hop permit 10->
 set ipv6 next-hop 2001:db8:209::1

R1# 
route-map set_next_hop permit 10->
 set ip next-hop 209.165.200.1

R1# 
route-map set_next_hop permit 10->
 set ip next-hop 2001:db8:209::2

R2# 
route-map set_next_hop permit 10->
 set ipv6 next-hop 2001:db8:209::2

R2# 
route-map set_next_hop permit 10->
 set ipv6 next-hop 2001:db8:209::1

R2# 
route-map set_next_hop permit 10->
 set ip next-hop 209.165.200.2
correct_answers:
R1# 
route-map set_next_hop permit 10->
 set ipv6 next-hop 2001:db8:209::1

R2# 
route-map set_next_hop permit 10->
 set ipv6 next-hop 2001:db8:209::2

question: What is the result when OSPFv3 is configured with no explicit RID, and there are no active IPv4 interfaces on the Router?
options: The RID must be manually configured and OSPFv3 adjacency will not form with router's neighbors
A RID will be automatically generated once an OSPFv3 adjacency with another OSPFv3 router is formed.
OSPFv3 running IPv6 does not require a RID and OSPFv3 adjacency will form normally.
The RID is set to the first 32 high order bits of the highest IPv6 interface address that is configured on the router.
correct_answers: The RID must be manually configured and OSPFv3 adjacency will not form with router's neighbors

question: Which two (2) statements are true regarding VRF LITE operation, (Choose 2:)?
options: show ip route vrf
show ip route
show ip vrf details
show ip vrf interfaces
correct_answers: show ip route vrf
show ip vrf interfaces
